result.execSummary:
All charges against Lawrence Antoine Benmon in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lawrence Antoine Benmon is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lawrence Antoine Benmon

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lawrence Antoine Benmon in court.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Lawrence Antoine Benmon.  Prosecuting attorney Claire E Zyber in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a Jury Trial.  State's witness is not available and the State is unable to proceed. Defense moves to dismiss the case. Court ordered case dismissed.

Defendant Lawrence Antoine Benmon in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Final pretrial proceeded.  State's offer stated on the record.  Defense rejects State's offer.  Case remains in jury trial posture.  Case is adjourned to 9-21-22 at 8:30 am for Jury Trial.

Defendant Lawrence Antoine Benmon in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defense is requesting final pretrial and jury trial dates. Case is adjourned to 8-18-22 at 8:30 am for final pretrial and 9-21-22 at 8:30 am for jury trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lawrence Antoine Benmon in court.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defendant is not working and may qualify for Public Defender representation.  Defendant to report to Public Defenders office after court to be reinterviewed.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with  JLL and SLL

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Lawrence Antoine Benmon in court with Attorney Travis Schwantes via zoom.  Defendant Lawrence Antoine Benmon in custody.  Mark Thomson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS NOT eligible FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION if the defendant remains in custody.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
